intro: Cheiranthus graecus, commonly known as the Greek candytuft, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring. It has a compact growth habit with hairy leaves and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Cheiranthus graecus is well-suited to rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun.
